alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 12:22PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Washington and west central Clarke Counties through 115 PM CDT... At 1222 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Wagarville, or 9 miles southeast of Chatom, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saint Stephens and Wagarville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
